title: No way to use `fn` with both const generics and `impl Trait`
body:
Say we have a function that uses both const generics and takes an `impl Trait` argument

```rust
fn const_add<const ARG: u64>(addable: impl std::ops::Add<u64>){
    addable + ARG;
}
```

The function itself compiles just fine... _but there is no way to use it_.

Specifying the argument like so
```rust
const_add::<5>(10);
```
does not work since one cannot provide explicit arguments when `impl Trait` is used [\[E0632\]](https://doc.rust-lang.org/nightly/error-index.html#E0632)
```
error[E0632]: cannot provide explicit generic arguments when `impl Trait` is used in argument position
 --> src/main.rs:6:17
  |
6 |     const_add::<5>(10);
  |                 ^ explicit generic argument not allowed
```

and if we remove the explicit arguments
```rust
const_add(10);
```
the compiler fairly complains that it doesn't know what value to use for the const generic [\[E0282\]](https://doc.rust-lang.org/nightly/error-index.html#E0282)
```
error[E0282]: type annotations needed
 --> src/main.rs:6:5
  |
6 |     const_add(10);
  |     ^^^^^^^^^ cannot infer the value of const parameter `ARG` declared on the function `const_add`
```

Workaround: Use explicit arguments instead of `impl Trait`
```rust
fn const_add<A, const ARG: u64>(addable: A)
where A: std::ops::Add<u64>
{
    addable + ARG;
}
```
and infer them with `_`
```rust
const_add::<_, 5>(10);
```

**TLDR**: `fn` with both `const` generic and `impl Trait` itself compiles, but is not useable in any way. _[Rust Playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=1520fbfc683e86aae0dbc8ccad6fb031)_

### Meta

Tested on both Stable `1.52.1` and Nightly `1.54.0-nightly (2021-05-18 4e3e6db011c5b482d2be)` channels, with same results.
